com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.utilities

Class DatabaseUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.utilities.DatabaseUtilities

  • public class DatabaseUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a conduit for database functionalities. It is utilizing Realm for the database. See the link below for Realm and their Wiki. https://realm.io/docs/java/latest/ Created by pmacdowell on 8/18/2016.

    • Method Detail

      • executeInsertIntoDB

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean executeInsertIntoDB(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                                                    java.lang.String jsonString,
                                                                    java.lang.Boolean appendToObject)
        Standard Database Insertion method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class will serve as the 'table' in the database
        jsonString - The json String (Standard JSON format) to put into the db.
        appendToObject - Boolean, if true, this will call 'updateOrWrite'. If it is false, it will call 'write'. The idea being that if you want the object already existing in the db to be overwritten entirely, set this to false, else, set it to true.
        Returns:
        Boolean. True if the insert succeeded, false if it did not

      • executeInsertIntoDB

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean executeInsertIntoDB(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                                                    java.io.InputStream is,
                                                                    java.lang.Boolean appendToObject)
        Standard Database Insertion method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class will serve as the 'table' in the database. Note! The class must extend RealmObject for it to be written into the db
        is - The InputStream (IS) to put into the db. Useful for fileWriting from a buffer.
        appendToObject - Boolean, if true, this will call 'updateOrWrite'. If it is false, it will call 'write'. The idea being that if you want the object already existing in the db to be overwritten entirely, set this to false, else, set it to true.
        Returns:
        Boolean. True if the insert succeeded, false if it did not

      • executeInsertIntoDB

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean executeInsertIntoDB(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                                                    JSONObject jsonObject,
                                                                    java.lang.Boolean appendToObject)
        Standard Database Insertion method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class will serve as the 'table' in the database Note! The class must extend RealmObject for it to be written into the db
        jsonObject - The json Object (Standard JSONObject format) to put into the db.
        appendToObject - Boolean, if true, this will call 'updateOrWrite'. If it is false, it will call 'write'. The idea being that if you want the object already existing in the db to be overwritten entirely, set this to false, else, set it to true.
        Returns:
        Boolean. True if the insert succeeded, false if it did not

      • persistObject

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean persistObject(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                                              T obj)
        This method will put objects (converted to JSON Strings using Gson) into a custom table. This works in that if you send an object, it WILL OVERRIDE the one in the database for it. This is used for persisting objects while using their class names as the primary key. If you send null as the obj, it will delete the persisted item in the DB. This entire method is mainly used for persisting 1 object of different classes. You can insert items into the DB normally, using other methods in this class if the goal is to persist more than one object NOTE: For the class objects being sent in, the fully qualified name of the object (in String form) will be used as its id. For example, it will look something like this: com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.pojos.SampleObject NOTE: The json String being pulled will be in JSON format, but will match the object model as per matching the class passed in. An example would be: {"age":30,"gender":"M","id":0,"name":"Patrick"}
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class that is of the object you are sending
        obj - Object to persist. If null is passed, it will delete any object matching that class name
        Returns:
        Return a boolean, true if suceeded, false if not

      • persistObjectCustom

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean persistObjectCustom(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                                                    T obj,
                                                                    java.lang.String customSuffix)
        Insert an object into the Master Table. For persisting objects
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class, in this method, the class will represent the ID in the table. If another object is sent with the same class, it will overwrite it.
        obj - The object to put into the db. (Will be converted to JSON using Gson)
        customSuffix - String of a custom suffix to be appended to the class name. This is used in the event that you want to have a secondary persisted object of the same type in the master table. An example would be that you have 2 user objects and want to persist both for X long. To do that, just add a custom suffix string (ie -user2) and it will be written into the masterobject table with an id (primary key) that matches that custom suffix. Use that same suffix again to delete it from the db.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if it succeeded, false if it did not

      • dePersistObject

        public boolean dePersistObject(java.lang.Class myClass)
        Delete an object from the Master Table. For deleting persisted objects
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class will be converted to string and used to reference the id / primary key to find the item / row.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if it succeeded, false if it did not

      • deletePersistedObject

        public boolean deletePersistedObject(java.lang.Class myClass)

      • dePersistObjectCustom

        public boolean dePersistObjectCustom(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                     java.lang.String customSuffix)
        Delete an object from the Master Table. For deleting persisted objects
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class will be converted to string and used to reference the id / primary key to find the item / row.
        customSuffix - String of a custom suffix to be appended to the class name. This is used in the event that you want to have a secondary persisted object of the same type in the master table. An example would be that you have 2 user objects and want to persist both for X long. To do that, just add a custom suffix string (ie -user2) and it will be written into the masterobject table with an id (primary key) that matches that custom suffix. Use that same suffix again to delete it from the db.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if it succeeded, false if it did not

      • deleteEntireDB

        public boolean deleteEntireDB(boolean areYouSure,
                              boolean areYouNotSure)
        DANGER ZONE! This will wipe the entire database (Of the configuration set. If you have multiple RealmConfigurations, you will need to create a DatabaseUtilities Object for each one and loop this method to delete them all).
        Parameters:
        areYouSure - Pass true to confirm wipe
        areYouNotSure - Pass false to confirm wipe
        Returns:
        Boolean of success or not

      • deleteAllPersistedObjects

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean deleteAllPersistedObjects(boolean areYouSure,
                                                                          boolean areYouNotSure)
        This will delete all persisted objects in the MasterDatabaseObject table
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        areYouSure - If you want to delete everything, send true here
        areYouNotSure - If you want to delete everything, send false here (Adding in '2 factor authentication' to prevent disasters)
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean, true if deletes succeeded, false if they did not

      • executeDeleteFromDB

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmObject> boolean executeDeleteFromDB(io.realm.RealmQuery query,
                                                                    java.lang.Class myClass)
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmObject
        Parameters:
        query - Query to delete. Keep in mind here, if you send no query, it will delete everything in that table.
        myClass - Class to reference (Table pulling from)
        Returns:
        return a boolean, true if it succeeded, false if it did not

      • getPersistedObject

        public java.lang.Object getPersistedObject(java.lang.Class myClass)
        Query the master table in the database
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class (row / id) to query
        Returns:
        returns an Object that was pulled from the DB. If nothing found, it will return null.

      • getAllPersistedObjects

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllPersistedObjects()
        Query the MasterDatabaseObject table (persisted objects) in the database for all rows
        Returns:
        returns a Map of type . The first String represents the key used in the MasterDatabaseObject table and the second String is the object converted into a String using Gson.toJson(). If there are no objects to return whatsoever, an empty map will be returned. NOTE: For the class objects being retrieved, the fully qualified name of the object (in String form) will be used as its id. For example, it will look something like this: com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.pojos.SampleObject NOTE: The json String being pulled will be in JSON format, but will match the object model as per matching the class passed in. An example would be: {"age":30,"gender":"M","id":0,"name":"Patrick"}

      • getPersistedObjectCustom

        public java.lang.Object getPersistedObjectCustom(java.lang.Class myClass,
                                                 java.lang.String customSuffix)
        Query the master table in the database
        Parameters:
        myClass - Class (row / id) to query
        customSuffix - Custom String suffix added (in the insert method) to add more space (more rows) for persisted objects.
        Returns:
        returns an Object that was pulled from the DB. If nothing found, it will return null.

      • queryDatabaseSingle

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmModel> java.lang.Object queryDatabaseSingle(io.realm.RealmQuery<T> passedQuery,
                                                                            java.lang.Class myClass)
        Query the database
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmModel (RealmResults)
        Parameters:
        passedQuery - The query to search with. If null is passed here, it will build a default query in which it searches everything.
        myClass - Class (table) that is being searched
        Returns:
        An object from the database (one from that table)

        public <T extends io.realm.RealmModel> java.util.List<java.lang.Object> queryDatabaseList(io.realm.RealmQuery<T> passedQuery,
                                                                                          java.lang.Class myClass)
        Query the database
        Type Parameters:
        T - T extends RealmModel (RealmResults)
        Parameters:
        passedQuery - The query to search with. If null is passed here, it will build a default query in which it searches everything.
        myClass - Class (table) that is being searched
        Returns:
        An list of objects from the database (all in that table)

      • buildRealm

        public static io.realm.Realm buildRealm(Context context)
        This method will build the Realm object using pre-programmed hard-coded info for the version and name. If you want to make your own custom version, please use the overloaded method which takes in a RealmConfiguration parameter
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        Returns:
        Realm object

      • buildRealmConfig

        public static io.realm.RealmConfiguration buildRealmConfig(Context context)
        This method will build the Realm configuration object using pre-programmed hard-coded info for the version and name. If you want to make your own custom version, please use the overloaded method which takes in multiple parameters
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        Returns:
        RealmConfiguration object

      • buildRealmConfig

        public static io.realm.RealmConfiguration buildRealmConfig(@NonNull
                                                           Context context,
                                                           java.lang.String dbName,
                                                           java.lang.Integer schemaVersion,
                                                           java.lang.Boolean deleteIfNeeded)
        Build a realm configuration file
        Parameters:
        context - Context, cannot be null
        dbName - The database name. If null, will default to a pre-set value
        schemaVersion - The schema version. Generally you want to increment these by one each time you change the schema. If left null, it will default to 1.
        deleteIfNeeded - Boolean, if true, the database will be wiped when updated if it is needed in order to complete the update. Set this to false if you want to manually take care of db updates/ concurrency issues.
        Returns:

      • copyDBToDownloadDirectory

        public static boolean copyDBToDownloadDirectory(java.lang.String dbName)
        Make a copy of the database and move it to the Download Folder
        Parameters:
        dbName - The name of the database. NOTE! MUST INCLUDE THE EXTENSION! (IE 'myDB.db')
        Returns:
        boolean, true if it succeeded, false if it did not
